## Description {#details}

Walks the defining accesses of MemoryDefs.

Stops after we hit something that has no defining use (e.g. a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memoryphi">MemoryPhi</a> or liveOnEntry). Note that, when comparing against a null <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/def-chain-iterator">def&#95;chain&#95;iterator</a>, this will compare equal only after walking said Phi/liveOnEntry.

The UseOptimizedChain flag specifies whether to walk the clobbering access chain, or all the accesses.

Normally, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydef">MemoryDef</a> are all just def/use linked together, so a def&#95;chain on a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydef">MemoryDef</a> will walk all MemoryDefs above it in the program until it hits a phi node. The optimized chain walks the clobbering access of a store. So if you are just trying to find, given a store, what the next thing that would clobber the same memory is, you want the optimized chain.

Definition at line 1325 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/memoryssa-h">MemorySSA.h</a>.
